text: A very brown ale type of lager. Sweet, roasted malt nose with a touch of grassy hops. Clear brown pour with thin, quick foam. Sweet malt taste, medium body. Slightly dry on the finish.

Can. Presents and drinks more like a brown ale (though its a lager) than an amber/Vienna. Kind of a hybrid. Nice caramel and roasty brown malt aroma and flavor, with a crisp bite at the end. Sessionable.

16 oz can at the 2016 Aiken Bluegrass Festival. Clear dark reddish brown body with a very good head. Smoke dark roasted malt flavor. Light hint of smoke but no char.
Overall: a robust brown ale worth seeking out.

16 0z can, pours crystal clear amber to chestnut with a fizzy large bubbly head of one finger which rapidly diminished to a thin covering. Aroma of caramel brown sugar. Crisp but thin and watery, overly carbonated a bit. Short on flavor. Not really impressed. I fail to understand why a microbrew beer automatically commands a higher rating than a similar macrobrew.
Can. Absolutely the best can beer I have ever had. Medium brown with a medium head. Aroma was nutty, chocolate. Taste was a pleasant roasted nut with a chocolate overtone and a hint of coffee.

Draft, Harbour Public House, Bainbridge. Med chestnut, aroma is pretty rich maltiness, sort of toffee/brown sugar note. Rich taste...same characteristics. Sweet, but not cloying. Full body. Really nice amber lager...definitely aiming high for a Vienna.

16 ounce can.

It pours a clear mahogany with an ample head of off white foam. Good lacing ensues.

The smell is sweetish, has a nuttiness, light grain, minimal bitterness.

Malty taste with mild sweets, bit of a nutty character, light grain and chocolate, mild bitterness. Mild...thats what this beer reminds me of. A Mild Ale.

Light bodied but not watery, good mouthfeel.

Very nice 4.2% abv beer!

Serving: from tap at Filibertos.

Aroma: light chocolate.

Appearance: small, frothy, light-brown initial head with fair lacing and fully diminishing longevity. Clear, dark-red body.

Taste: lightly sweet and chocolatey initial flavor and finish with average duration.

Palate: light-to-medium bodied with watery texture and lively carbonation.

Overall: excellent. Great aroma and flavor.

Nice roast and nutty character in the aroma. Pours a nice brunette with creamy head and good lacing. Really good flavors roast, nutty and chocolate with a nice body clean finish. Bigger flavors then I was expecting. I think they got a winner here.

Draught. Pours a clear brown color with a small head on it. Nose is very toast with some slight roasting to it. Taste has some nice toast to it, with a bit of nuttiness coming through underneath. Nothing earth-shattering, but a very pleasant drink for me.
Draft at sb. Pours a clear medium amber with a loose white head. Mild sweet caramel nose. Creamy medium body with slippery carb. Toasty caramel mid palate with a long toasty finish.
Deep amber hue, dense head. Nice dusty chocolate and roastyness in the aroma. Appealing chocolate and malty melanoidin body. Chocolate sweetness throughout. A really good chocolate lager.

pours a dark amber with a thin tan head, and very good lacing.

smell is faint, some malt, and some caramel.

taste is a little on the watery side, nutty, brown sugar, and roasted malt. ends tangy and slightly bitter.

From can. Amber brown pour with off-white head. Caramel and roasted malts on the nose. Taste is caramel and roasted malts, nicely sweet and balanced. Very smooth. Thin mouthfeel. Easy to drink and delicious.

16 oz can bought from "Lifesource" in Salem OR
$2.49
Pours a darker chestnut brown colour with a nice sized thick and creamy tan head.
Nice creamy fudge malty aroma,very welcoming, touch of brown sugar and sweet coffee,slight floral hop.
Taste is similar to the aroma but the coffee is darker and semi-bitter, surprised this is a lager, and like Brewdad says its hard to place.Its a little like Full Sail Session Black...
Mouthfeeel is rather thin but adds to drinkability..carbonation is medium..
Nice session type beer whatever the style is.
Called a Euro Dark Lager there was no style to put this under. If you have a better one please correct it. Awesome flavor and rich dark malt flavors. Nice caramel and light chocolate.

Roasty to Coffee scent and taste, 
Creamy to
Light to
Dry finish, with 
Dark brown color

---Rated via Beer Buddy by stoneagerad
Clear light brown color/ lasting ivory head. Nice nutty, roasty, pale malt aromas. Watered down medium roast malt, nutty, pale malt flavors--
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Listed as a lager. The nose was of roasted nuts, light crisp earthy hops, and a touch of malty sweetness. Pours brown with a thin head that settles to a ring. Roasted and toasted nuts, hints of sweetness with a clean crisp finish. Very drinkable with nice flavors. Well done.
